title: ICBC contributes to EUR 561 million syndicated loan tranche to Afreximbank for trade financing and general corporate purposes in June 2017 (Linked to Project ID#92380, #92383, #92385, #92395, and #92397)
description: On May 30, 2017, the African Export-Import Bank (Afreximbank) signed a $1.16 syndicated loan facility agreement with a group of 35 banks for trade financing and general corporate purposes. The loan consisted of two tranches: a $632 million tranche with a maturity length between two and three years and an interest rate of LIBOR plus a 1.25% to 1.40% margin and an EUR 561 million ($528 million) tranche with a maturity length of three years and an interest rate of EURIBOR plus a 1.3% margin. Standard Chartered Bank served as coordinator, bookrunner and agent for the facility and was supported by 13 initial mandated lead arrangers and bookrunners. These are: Bank ABC (Arab Banking Corporation B.S.C.); Abu Dhabi Commercial Bank PJSC; The Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ, Ltd.; Barclays Bank Mauritius Limited; Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation Europe Ltd.; Commerzbank Aktiengesellschaft Filiale Luxemburg; Emirates NBD Capital Limited; Rand Merchant Bank, a division of FirstRand Bank Limited (London Branch); HSBC Bank plc.; ICBC (London) plc.; Mizuho Bank Ltd.; National Bank of Abu Dhabi PJSC; and The Standard Bank of South Africa Limited, Isle of Man Branch. The 13 initial mandated lead arrangers and bookrunners were joined at the general syndication stage by AKA Ausfuhrkredit; Axis Bank; Bank of China; Bank of Taiwan; Banque Misr; Commercial Bank of Kuwait; Export-Import Bank of China; First Commercial Bank; State Bank of India; Chang Hwa Commercial Bank; Land Bank of Taiwan; Mega International Commercial Bank Co.; Shanghai Commercial and Savings Bank; Barclays Bank Egypt; Ghana International Bank; KEB Hana Bank; Taipei Fubon Commercial Bank; The Export – Import Bank of the Republic of China; Export-Import Bank of Korea; and Federated Investors, Inc. as mandated lead arrangers and arrangers.  This project captures ICBC's contribution to the EUR 561 million tranche. Linked Project ID#92395 captures China Eximbank's contribution. Linked Project ID#92397 captures BOC's contribution.  Linked Project ID#92380 captures China Eximbank's contribution to the $632 million tranche. Linked Project ID#92383 captures ICBC's contribution. Linked Project ID#92385 captures BOC's contribution.
staff_comments: 1. The exact sizes of the contributions from China Eximbank, ICBC, and Bank of China to the loan syndicate are unknown. For the time being, AidData assumes equal contributions to the dollar-denominated loan tranche ($18,057,142) and the euro-denominated loan tranche (EUR 16,028,571) across the 35 participants in the loan syndicate.2. AidData has estimated the all-in interest rate for the dollar-denominated tranche by adding 1.325% (the midpoint between 1.25% and 1.4%) to average 6-month LIBOR in May 2017 (1.425%).3. AidData has estimated the all-in interest rate for the euro-denominated tranche by adding 1.3% to average 6-month EURIBOR in May 2017 (-0.251%).4. AidData has estimated the maturity length of the dollar-denominated tranche by taking the midpoint between 2 years and three years.5. For the time being, AidData assumes that all lenders participated in both tranches. This issue warrants further investigation.6. This loan is not included in the Chinese Loans to Africa Database developed by SAIS-CARI and maintained by the Global Development Policy Center at Boston University.
combined_text:
# Sector
BANKING AND FINANCIAL SERVICES

# Title
ICBC contributes to EUR 561 million syndicated loan tranche to Afreximbank for trade financing and general corporate purposes in June 2017 (Linked to Project ID#92380, #92383, #92385, #92395, and #92397)

# Description
On May 30, 2017, the African Export-Import Bank (Afreximbank) signed a $1.16 syndicated loan facility agreement with a group of 35 banks for trade financing and general corporate purposes. The loan consisted of two tranches: a $632 million tranche with a maturity length between two and three years and an interest rate of LIBOR plus a 1.25% to 1.40% margin and an EUR 561 million ($528 million) tranche with a maturity length of three years and an interest rate of EURIBOR plus a 1.3% margin. Standard Chartered Bank served as coordinator, bookrunner and agent for the facility and was supported by 13 initial mandated lead arrangers and bookrunners. These are: Bank ABC (Arab Banking Corporation B.S.C.); Abu Dhabi Commercial Bank PJSC; The Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ, Ltd.; Barclays Bank Mauritius Limited; Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation Europe Ltd.; Commerzbank Aktiengesellschaft Filiale Luxemburg; Emirates NBD Capital Limited; Rand Merchant Bank, a division of FirstRand Bank Limited (London Branch); HSBC Bank plc.; ICBC (London) plc.; Mizuho Bank Ltd.; National Bank of Abu Dhabi PJSC; and The Standard Bank of South Africa Limited, Isle of Man Branch. The 13 initial mandated lead arrangers and bookrunners were joined at the general syndication stage by AKA Ausfuhrkredit; Axis Bank; Bank of China; Bank of Taiwan; Banque Misr; Commercial Bank of Kuwait; Export-Import Bank of China; First Commercial Bank; State Bank of India; Chang Hwa Commercial Bank; Land Bank of Taiwan; Mega International Commercial Bank Co.; Shanghai Commercial and Savings Bank; Barclays Bank Egypt; Ghana International Bank; KEB Hana Bank; Taipei Fubon Commercial Bank; The Export – Import Bank of the Republic of China; Export-Import Bank of Korea; and Federated Investors, Inc. as mandated lead arrangers and arrangers.  This project captures ICBC's contribution to the EUR 561 million tranche. Linked Project ID#92395 captures China Eximbank's contribution. Linked Project ID#92397 captures BOC's contribution.  Linked Project ID#92380 captures China Eximbank's contribution to the $632 million tranche. Linked Project ID#92383 captures ICBC's contribution. Linked Project ID#92385 captures BOC's contribution.
justification: Project involves trade financing and general corporate purposes without specific environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Syndicated loan facility for trade financing and general corporate purposes, no specific energy or environmental components mentioned

For the time being, AidData assumes that all lenders participated in both tranches. This issue warrants further investigation.6. title: ICBC participates in $200 million syndicated three-year term loan facility to Africa Finance Corporation (AFC) for general corporate purposes
description: In 2017, Africa Finance Corporation (AFC) signed a US$200mn three-year term loan facility, to be used for general corporate purposes, including facilitating trade. The facility will support the execution of the corporation’s infrastructure development mandate and provide the necessary capital resources required to continue bridging Africa’s infrastructure deficit and facilitating international trade.  Mandated lead arrangers and book runners on the facility were First Abu Dhabi Bank, Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, Rand Merchant Bank and Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group. KfW Ipex-Bank joined as an arranger. Norton Rose Fulbright and Jackson Etti & Edu acted as lenders’ counsel, with White & Case as borrower’s counsel.
staff_comments: The precise size of the contribution of ICBC to the loan syndicate is unknown. For the time being, AidData assumes equal contributions to the $200 million loan ($40,000,000) across the 5 known participants in the loan syndicate.
combined_text:
# Sector
UNALLOCATED/UNSPECIFIED

# Title
ICBC participates in $200 million syndicated three-year term loan facility to Africa Finance Corporation (AFC) for general corporate purposes

# Description
In 2017, Africa Finance Corporation (AFC) signed a US$200mn three-year term loan facility, to be used for general corporate purposes, including facilitating trade. The facility will support the execution of the corporation’s infrastructure development mandate and provide the necessary capital resources required to continue bridging Africa’s infrastructure deficit and facilitating international trade.  Mandated lead arrangers and book runners on the facility were First Abu Dhabi Bank, Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, Rand Merchant Bank and Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group. KfW Ipex-Bank joined as an arranger. Norton Rose Fulbright and Jackson Etti & Edu acted as lenders’ counsel, with White & Case as borrower’s counsel.
justification: Loan facility for general corporate purposes without specific environmental or energy transition focus
evidence: General corporate purposes, infrastructure development mandate, trade facilitation

title: Chinese Government provides $3 million grant — via ETCA — for the provision of equipment to rehabilitate the National Theatre of Opera and Ballet and Folkloric Ensemble and other unspecified activities (Linked to Project ID#66128)
description: In 2017, the Chinese Government provided a $2 million grant — through an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) — to the Government of Albania for the provision of equipment to rehabilitate the National Theatre of Opera and Ballet and Folkloric Ensemble and other unspecified activities. On May 9th, 2017, the Chinese government allocated 10mln for the renovation of the National Opera and Ballet Theatre and People’s Ensemble. The recipient of this grant was the Ministry of Culture. The estimated completion date for the project is September 15th, 2020. The inauguration of the National Theatre of Opera and Ballet occurred five years after reconstruction.
staff_comments: It appears that the proceeds from this grant were to fund the National Theatre of Opera, Ballet, and Folkloric Ensemble Reconstruction Project (captured in Project ID#66128). Therefore, to minimize the risk of double-counting, AidData has categorized the record as an umbrella project for the time being. Project ID#66128 is also associated with rehabilitation of the National Theatre of Opera and Ballet and Folkloric Ensemble.
combined_text:

On May 9th, 2017, the Chinese government allocated 10mln for the renovation of the National Opera and Ballet Theatre and People’s Ensemble. The recipient of this grant was the Ministry of Culture. The estimated completion date for the project is September 15th, 2020. The inauguration of the National Theatre of Opera and Ballet occurred five years after reconstruction.
justification: Project focuses on cultural infrastructure rehabilitation without clear environmental or energy transition impacts

title: Chinese Government provides EUR 329,351 grant for provision of musical instruments for the RTSH Symphonic Orchestra
description: In 2017, the Chinese Government issued a EUR 329,351 grant to the Government of Albania for the provision of musical instruments for the RTSH Symphonic Orchestra. The recipient of this grant was the Albanian Radio and Television (RTSH). According to official data that Albania’s Donor Technical Secretariat shared with AidData in February 2018, the project commenced on May 19, 2017, and reached completion on December 31, 2018. The implementing agency was the Economic and Commercial Counselor's Office of the Chinese Embassy in Albania.

title: China grants for Seminar on Agriculture Technology and Water Resource Management for Albania in 2017
description: On August 29th, 2017, the Chinese Embassy to Albania inaugurated the China-Albanian Human Resources Development Cooperation Project. The project is alternatively identified as the Chinese Seminar on Agriculture Technology and Water Resource Management for Albania in 2017.  To implement the project, The Economic and Commercial Counselor's Office of Chinese Embassy in Albania provided a €131,652 euro grant to the Albanian Government. According to the Albanian government, the project took place from September 4th, 2017, to September 24th, 2017.   At the inauguration of the project, Chinese Ambassador to Albania, Jiang Yu, and Albanian Minister of Agriculture Panariti, met with all the Albanian participants attending the Seminar on Agriculture Technology and Water Resource Management for Albania in Beijing, China. The seminar was organized by China Agricultural University and the Tirana Agricultural University of Albania. The seminar covers  agricultural development, poverty reduction experience, water resources management, and participants will visit planting bases, irrigation centers, sewage treatment plants and more locations.  The project falls within the framework of an economic cooperation and technical agreement (ETCA) signed in on October 10th, 2016 by the Albanian Ministry of Agriculture and the Chinese Ministry of Water Resources concerning cooperation in the field of water resources management.
staff_comments: 1. Chinese title for the project is 中阿农业人力资源开发合作项.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
China grants for Seminar on Agriculture Technology and Water Resource Management for Albania in 2017

# Description
On August 29th, 2017, the Chinese Embassy to Albania inaugurated the China-Albanian Human Resources Development Cooperation Project. The project is alternatively identified as the Chinese Seminar on Agriculture Technology and Water Resource Management for Albania in 2017.  To implement the project, The Economic and Commercial Counselor's Office of Chinese Embassy in Albania provided a €131,652 euro grant to the Albanian Government. According to the Albanian government, the project took place from September 4th, 2017, to September 24th, 2017.   At the inauguration of the project, Chinese Ambassador to Albania, Jiang Yu, and Albanian Minister of Agriculture Panariti, met with all the Albanian participants attending the Seminar on Agriculture Technology and Water Resource Management for Albania in Beijing, China. The seminar was organized by China Agricultural University and the Tirana Agricultural University of Albania. The seminar covers  agricultural development, poverty reduction experience, water resources management, and participants will visit planting bases, irrigation centers, sewage treatment plants and more locations.  The project falls within the framework of an economic cooperation and technical agreement (ETCA) signed in on October 10th, 2016 by the Albanian Ministry of Agriculture and the Chinese Ministry of Water Resources concerning cooperation in the field of water resources management.
justification: Project focuses on knowledge sharing and capacity building in agriculture and water management without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Seminar on agriculture technology and water resource management, knowledge transfer focus, no direct infrastructure development

title: Chinese Government grants 131,652 euros to Albania for Non-traditional Security Threats Seminar
description: In 2017, the Chinese Government granted 131,652 euros for a Seminar on Non-traditional Security Threats for Albania in Hangzhou, China. Seminar participants were from the State Police & Ministry of Interior. This project started on May 4, 2017 and reached completion on May 24, 2017. The seminar was to teach the State Police & Ministry of Interior on how to handle security threats, organized crime, terrorism, and trafficking.

# Description
In 2017, the Chinese Government granted 131,652 euros for a Seminar on Non-traditional Security Threats for Albania in Hangzhou, China. Seminar participants were from the State Police & Ministry of Interior. This project started on May 4, 2017 and reached completion on May 24, 2017. title: Chinese Government provides EUR 1.3 million grant for Demonstration Center for Agricultural Machinery Cooperation Project (Linked to Project ID#42414)
description: In 2017, China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) — through its Economic and Commercial Counselor's Office in Albania — issued a EUR 1,317,632 grant to the Government of Albania for the Demonstration Center for Agricultural Machinery Cooperation Project. The purpose of this project was to establish an agricultural demonstration center in the town of Cërrik focused on the use of agricultural machinery and technologies. According to official data that Albania’s Donor Technical Secretariat shared with AidData in February 2018, the project commenced on May 22, 2017, and reached completion on December 31, 2018.  The following are meetings, milestones, announcements regarding the project:  On September 29th, 2016, China’s Ambassador to Albania, Jiang Yu, and the Albanian Minister of Agriculture discussed the possibility of a Demonstration Center for Agricultural Machinery Cooperation Project.  On April 13th, 2017 in an interview, Ambassador to Albania, Jiang Yu, announced plans to develop an Agricultural Machinery Cooperative Demonstration Center with Albania.  On May 25th, 2017 Chinese Ambassador to Albania, Jiang Yu, and Albanian Minister of Agriculture, Panariti, conducted preliminary talks on the construction of a demonstration center for agricultural machinery co-operation.   On December 1st, 2017 the Chinese Economic and Commercial Counselor to Albania, Chen Kailong, met the Albanian Deputy Minister of Agriculture, Harry Rai, to discuss the agricultural demonstration center.  On December 22nd and 23rd, 2017, representatives from the Chinese Ministry of Commerce and the Chinese Academy of Agricultural Mechanization Sciences inspected the site of the project in Cërrik City, Albania in cooperation with the Albanian Ministry of Agriculture.  On April 16th, 2018 Chinese Ambassador to Albania, Jiang Yu traveled to Cërrik City, Albania to inspect the progress of the project.   On July 5th, 2018, The Albanian-Chinese Center for Innovation, Science and Agricultural Technology, a different center than the Agricultural Machinery Cooperative Demonstration Center was opened in the Agricultural University of Tirana. The center for innovation was founded to promote communications on agricultural policies between Albania and China. (Documented in Project ID#67597)  On July 6th, 2018, in a meeting with Albanian Prime Minister Edi Rama, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang announced China’s intention to build the center in Albania.   On September 27th, 2018, the Chinese Ambassador to Albania, Jiang Yu, and Albanian Minister of Agriculture discussed increased agricultural cooperation including the development of the Agricultural Machinery Cooperative Demonstration Center Project.
staff_comments: The Chinese name of the project is 阿尔巴尼亚农业机械合作示范中心项目. The grant proceeds that funded this project may have been drawn from the 2014 ETCA for education, science, agriculture, and technology projects (captured in Project ID#42414).

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 200 million grant — via ETCA — for Youth Culture and Leisure Complex Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#52453)
description: Between October 26, 2015 and November 15, 2015, Hunan Provincial Architectural Design Institute undertook a feasibility study for the Youth Culture and Leisure Complex Construction Project (with support from China’s Ministry of Commerce). Then, on June 2, 2016, the Chinese Government and the Government of Algeria signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA), which committed RMB 100 million of grant funding for the Youth Culture and Leisure Complex Construction Project (captured in Project ID#52453). The agreement was signed by Yang Guangyu, Ambassador of China to Algeria, and the Algerian Secretary-General of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.   On December 3, 2017, the Chinese Government and the Government of Algeria signed another Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA), which committed an additional RMB 200 million of grant funding for the Youth Culture and Leisure Complex Construction Project (captured in Project ID#61201).    The purpose of this project was to build a Youth Culture and Leisure Complex in the town of Diar El Baraka within the commune of Baraki. The complex will occupy 28,300 square meters and include a theater with 450 seats, 3 theaters with 50 seats,  2 sculpture rooms, 2 painting rooms, 3 rooms for language teaching, a multipurpose sports palace, a 50 meters swimming pool, two 25 meter swimming pools, a water basin for children, a youth hostel with 50 beds, several outdoor football pitches, administrative offices, and  auxiliary equipment rooms.   Sinomach is the contractor responsible for project implementation. The funder of the project (MOFCOM) conducted a project site visit on May 9, 2018. Then, a project implementation agreement was signed on December 4, 2018.  In September 2019, a geotechnical engineering survey was undertaken at the project site. It does not appear that construction has commenced.
staff_comments: This project is also known as the Algeria Youth Cultural Palace project. The French project title is Palais culturel et de loisirs or Palais culturel et de loisirs pour les jeunes. The Chinese project title is 阿尔及利亚青年文化宫项目 or 中国援阿尔及利亚青年文化宫项目.

The purpose of this project was to build a Youth Culture and Leisure Complex in the town of Diar El Baraka within the commune of Baraki. title: China donates $5 million to UNDP for relief to the Caribbean following Hurricane Maria
description: In October 2017, the Chinese Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) granted $5 million USD to UNDP for emergency relief to countries affected by Hurricanes Maria and Irma. The aid will be used to fund reconstruction efforts in countries such as the Dominican Republic, Dominica and Antigua and Barbuda. China has continued to fund a number of relief efforts through its South-South Cooperation initiative (SSC). Emergency support provided by Chinese and UNDP exports has been successful in helping the Caribbean rebuild. The project completed at the end of June, 2018.  In Dominica, 488 buildings were restored including three schools, five health care centers and essential government buildings, the main hospital, and the state college. combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
China donates $5 million to UNDP for relief to the Caribbean following Hurricane Maria

# Description
In October 2017, the Chinese Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) granted $5 million USD to UNDP for emergency relief to countries affected by Hurricanes Maria and Irma. The aid will be used to fund reconstruction efforts in countries such as the Dominican Republic, Dominica and Antigua and Barbuda. China has continued to fund a number of relief efforts through its South-South Cooperation initiative (SSC). Emergency support provided by Chinese and UNDP exports has been successful in helping the Caribbean rebuild. The project completed at the end of June, 2018.  In Dominica, 488 buildings were restored including three schools, five health care centers and essential government buildings, the main hospital, and the state college. In Antigua and Barbuda, 302 homes and essential facilities were served with roofing materials.
justification: Project is focused on emergency relief and social infrastructure rebuilding without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Funding for reconstruction of schools, healthcare centers, government buildings, and homes following hurricane damage
